CHAT.comment: Home Visit 5; Chi leaning against and writing on coffee table; Mot sitting perpendicular to Chi against couch

Chi is uncooperative at first but once Mot narrows down who to write to Chi determines part of the text himself; to help spell dear Mot says it rhymes with this (and holds her ear); Chi has a rather hard time with spelling and tends to leave vowels out of words;
Dear Aunt Peggy Thank you for the wonderful dinner and party. I had fun. Love , Chi xoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxo

u.a: not very close to tape recorder
says is getting something to eat; is in kitchen
tells Chi he's had enough sugar , cookies
maybe capital D@l looks like o@l
Chi has written a small p
taps Chi's rear end playfully meaning <come on>
talking about how they're really into capital letters now
says <he gets his words wrong on his spelling tests if he . . . . she throws in a couple challenge words if it's not right . . .>
EXP seems convinced that Chi is just pretending that he doesn't know won
Chi went to find word on a card
describes cake to EXs; takes about 20 seconds

CHAT.comment: short discussion of x's and o's follows between Mot and EXP
